metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7826 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Memory safety bugs were reported in Firefox 56 and Firefox ESR 52.4. Someof these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 57, Firefox ESR < 52.5, andThunderbird < 52.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.1+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:52.6.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
